If you finally want to stick to a REALISTIC health routine you need to start with how YOU want to feel and then be clear on who you need to become. Itâ€™s the only way to make lasting change. (DONâ€™T jump straight to the actions.. this is the biggest mistake people make!) For example, I want to feel energetic, healthy and confident. Cool! Who do I need to become to feel that way? Likely someone who prioritizes my physical and mental health. Someone who does â€œthe workâ€ to change my mindset and the Fâ€™S I give.. but I canâ€™t become this person overnight!!!! Once you are clear with how you want to feel then you can ID small physical and mental shifts that you can build from. The first step is getting clear on what you can do, then building from there with realistic expectations and tools to work through the inevitable resistance to change. This is exactly what I help you do. But I also have a free tool to help you get started. If you would like my free tool comment â€œtoolâ€ below and I will send it to you! Youâ€™ve got this! It doesnâ€™t have to be so hard! Get clear. Start small. Then build! Stop throwing too much on the pile too early. Is Your Relationship Healthy? Take This Quiz to Find Out! As a Psychologist, Clinical Hypnotherapist, and Relationship coach, We have created a simple yet insightful tool to help you evaluate the health of your relationships. Healthy relationships are essential for our well-being, so take a moment to see where yours stands. Download Your Free Relationship Health : checklist! https://lnkd.in/gaTQ4_ua How Did Your Relationship Score? If you find more traits from the unhealthy side in your relationship, it might be time to reflect and seek improvement. Healthy relationships are built on respect, trust, and mutual support. Understanding where your relationship stands is the first step toward building a healthier connection. Remember, no relationship is perfect, but recognizing and addressing unhealthy patterns can lead to significant positive changes. Take a moment to reflect on this question. What changes can you make today to foster a healthier, more fulfilling relationship? Your well-being and happiness are crucial. Healthy relationships contribute to a happier, more balanced life. If you need guidance or support, reach out to a professional. You deserve to thrive in your relationships! Share your thoughts and experiences Follow us for more insights and tips on mental health, relationships, and personal growth! #HealthyRelationships #RelationshipAdvice #MentalHealth #Therapy #PersonalGrowth #RelationshipCoach #SelfAssessment

Entrepreneur Stress: The entrepreneurial journey is immensely rewarding but also highly stressful at times. As founders and business owners, our work is our passion. But without self-care, we can burn out. Here are some ways to preserve your mental health along the way: - Carve out dedicated non-negotiable time for activities and people that recharge you. - Set work boundaries and stick to them - learn to unplug at the end of the day. - Build a support network of fellow entrepreneurs who understand the ups and downs. - Practice mindfulness to manage stress in the moment when things get hectic. - Focus on the progress made rather than get bogged down in setbacks. - Get outdoors, exercise, eat well, and prioritize rest to boost resilience to stress. - If needed, seek professional help - there's no shame in therapy. Our businesses need us at our best. With intention, we can sustain our drive, passion, and mental wellbeing over the entrepreneurial marathon. #EntrepreneurStress #StartUpStress #FounderLife #FounderProblems #MentalHealthMatters #SelfCare #Resilience #StressManagement #Burnout #WorkLifeBalance #Mindfulness #Meditation #SupportSystem #AskForHelp #Therapy #ExecutiveCoaching #Leadership #EmotionalIntelligence #Wellness #PositivePsychology #CognitiveBehavioralTherapy #Anxiety #Depression #Loneliness #ImposterSyndrome #FailureMindset #Perfectionism #GoalSetting #TimeManagement #SelfCompassion #Exercise #Nutrition #SleepHygiene #CreativeOutlets #Journaling #Meditation #BreathingExercises #VCBetterTogether #StartupGrind #FoundersPledge #EntrepreneursOrganization #YPO #YEC #AmericanPsychologicalAssociation #ASA #ISMA #AFSP #NAMIC #ADAA #IAHPC

"Progress is progress, no matter how small"âœ¨ When youâ€™re staring down a big task, itâ€™s easy to feel paralyzed by the enormity of it all. The key to overcoming this overwhelm is to break the task into smaller, more manageable steps. By focusing on just the first step, you reduce the mental burden and build momentum. This method not only makes the task seem less intimidating but also taps into the power of small wins, boosting your confidence and productivity along the way. ------- Follow Dr Pooja Patel for holistic growth tips and guidance.
